user_stories.title: Remove duplicate 'idea' CLI command from codebase
acceptance_criteria: The 'idea' command registration is removed from src/index.ts
Running 'wreckit idea --help' returns an error: 'unknown command'
Only the 'ideas' command exists in the CLI
Git diff shows exactly 28 lines removed from src/index.ts (lines 123-153 in HEAD)
No other code changes are made to src/index.ts
user_stories.notes: The change has already been made in the working tree. This story is about verifying and committing that change. The code to remove is at src/index.ts lines 123-153 in commit 25fc304.

user_stories.title: Add CHANGELOG entry documenting the breaking change
acceptance_criteria: CHANGELOG.md includes a new section '## [Unreleased]'
Under '### Breaking Changes' or '### Removed', documents the 'idea' command removal
Changelog explains that users should use 'wreckit ideas' instead
Changelog clarifies that all functionality is preserved in the 'ideas' command
Changelog notes that 'ideas' supports file input, stdin, and interactive interview modes
user_stories.notes: Add the entry under '## [Unreleased]' at the top of CHANGELOG.md, after the existing '## [1.0.0]' section. This is a pre-1.0 breaking change but should be documented for users upgrading.

user_stories.title: Verify no code references to 'idea' command remain
acceptance_criteria: Searching codebase for 'command("idea")' returns no results
Searching codebase for '.command("idea")' returns no results
The only matches for 'idea' are: state machine references (idea â†’ researched), variable names, or comments
No documentation files reference 'wreckit idea' command (already verified: README.md and AGENTS.md only use 'ideas')
user_stories.notes: Use grep to search for any lingering references: grep -r 'command.*idea' src/ --exclude-dir=__tests__ may show false positives (state machine refs). Focus on command registration only.

user_stories.title: Manually test CLI to verify 'idea' command is removed and 'ideas' works
acceptance_criteria: Running 'wreckit --help' shows 'ideas' in the command list
Running 'wreckit --help' does NOT show 'idea' in the command list
Running 'wreckit idea --help' errors with 'unknown command 'idea''
Running 'wreckit ideas --help' displays command help successfully
Running 'wreckit ideas --file <test-file>' creates items successfully
Running 'echo "test" | wreckit ideas' processes stdin input successfully
Other CLI commands (status, list, show, run) continue to work normally
user_stories.notes: Perform manual testing before committing. Create a temporary test file with sample ideas. Test both TTY and non-TTY modes if possible. Verify no regressions in other commands.

user_stories.title: Create git commit with conventional commit format
acceptance_criteria: Commit message uses 'refactor:' prefix
Commit message title: 'refactor: remove duplicate 'idea' CLI command, use 'ideas' instead'
Commit body explains that 'idea' and 'ideas' were identical
Commit body notes this is a pre-1.0 breaking change
Commit body lists all files changed (src/index.ts, CHANGELOG.md)
Commit body includes line counts: 'Removes 28 lines from src/index.ts'
Commit references the item ID: 'Closes: #001-consolidate-duplicate-cli-commands-idea-and-ideas'
user_stories.notes: Use conventional commit format. The commit should include both the src/index.ts change and the CHANGELOG.md update. Run 'git add src/index.ts CHANGELOG.md' then commit.
